author: Irina Anghel
description: A closely watched gauge of demand from potential British homeowners climbed to its highest level in six months, a signal that the real estate market is starting to stabilizing from a tax-increase induced slowdown that’s weighed on house prices.
title: UK Homebuyer Demand Rebounds to a Six-Month High, Index Shows

author: Nicola M White
description: Putting digital versions of stocks on a blockchain doesn’t mean companies can skirt US securities laws, the Securities and Exchange Commission’s Hester Peirce said Wednesday.
title: SEC’s Peirce Says Tokenized Securities Must Comply With Rules

author: Alex Wickham, Samy Adghirni
description: The UK and French governments plan to order more of the Storm Shadow cruise missiles that they’ve been supplying to Ukraine, as well as accelerate efforts to develop a next-generation replacement for the weapons.
title: UK and France Order More Cruise Missiles, Pledge Nuclear Cooperation

author: Patpicha Tanakasempipat, Philip Heijmans
description: Thaksin Shinawatra’s nearly three-decade dominance of Thai politics is coming to an end.
title: Humbled Thai Billionaire Is a Warning to Trump-Era Populists

author: Daniel Carvalho, Barbara Nascimento
description: Donald Trump’s threat to impose 50% tariffs on Brazilian goods sent the country’s currency plunging as the US leader sharply escalated a dispute with Latin America’s largest nation and leftist leader Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva.
title: Trump Hikes Brazil Tariff Rate to 50%, Sending Assets Reeling

author: Myles Miller
description: Homeland Security Secretary Kristi Noem reiterated her call to overhaul the Federal Emergency Management Agency, even as the organization helps in search and recovery efforts following the catastrophic flooding in Texas that’s left more than 100 people dead.
title: Kristi Noem Renews Call to Eliminate FEMA Even After Texas Flood

author: Matthew Boesler
description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Today, economy editor Matthew Boesler looks at why the president’s pick for the next Fed chair won’t be able to lower interest rates alone. Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.
title: Trump May Find Prodding the Fed on Interest Rates Not so Simple

author: Eric Roston
description: Sheldon Whitehouse will give his 300th floor speech on climate on Wednesday, less than a week after Congress rolled back clean energy incentives.
title: Senator Raises Climate Warning Amid Texas Floods and Trump’s Tax Bill

author: Jamie Tarabay
description: Senate Majority Leader John Thune said Wednesday he expects a vote as soon as this month to place severe new sanctions on Russia, the latest sign of a growing fracture between Donald Trump and Vladimir Putin, a man the US president once said he admired.
title: Senate Republicans Eye Russia Sanctions as Trump Amps Up Putin Rhetoric

author: Erik Hertzberg
description: One of the largest departments in the Canadian government told employees they may face job losses as Prime Minister Mark Carney searches for spending cuts to keep the budget deficit contained.
title: Government Employees in Canada Face Job Cuts as Carney Looks to Trim Spending

author: Simone Iglesias
description: Brazil’s foreign ministry has asked the highest representative of the US government in Brasilia to explain an embassy statement echoing President Donald Trump’s claims that former leader Jair Bolsonaro is facing political persecution, according to two people familiar with the situation.
title: Brazil Asks US Embassy to Explain Pro-Bolsonaro Statement

author: Courtney McBride, Akayla Gardner
description: President Donald Trump said negotiators are “very close” to a ceasefire deal between Israel and Hamas, raising optimism for a long-elusive agreement as Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu visits the US.
title: Trump Touts Push Toward Gaza Deal as Netanyahu Visits Pentagon

author: Allyson Versprille
description: The US Senate confirmed former airline executive Bryan Bedford to lead the Federal Aviation Administration, giving the regulator a permanent chief as it prepares to embark on an overhaul of the nation’s air traffic control system.
title: Ex-Airline Chief Bryan Bedford Confirmed by Senate to Lead FAA

author: Georgina Boos
description: Partisan political tensions in the US soared to a six-year high last month, according to a gauge published by the Federal Reserve Bank of Philadelphia, amid clashes over President Donald Trump’s tax bill and immigration policies.
title: US Political Tension Climbs to Six-Year High in Philly Fed Index

author: Bill Allison
description: Elon Musk, the single biggest Republican donor in the 2024 elections, says he wants to create a new political party to lower the US national debt, which currently stands at $37 trillion.
title: Why Elon Musk’s Third Party Plans Face Big Hurdles

author: Daniele Lepido
description: The eldest son of the late Italian Prime Minister Silvio Berlusconi hinted that he could potentially follow his father’s footsteps and seek office one day.
title: Berlusconi’s Heir Says He’s Tempted by Politics, Has No Plan Yet

author: Hadriana Lowenkron
description: US President Donald Trump unveiled a new round of tariff demand letters on Wednesday with levies set to hit in August on imported goods from partners who fail to reach agreements with the US.
title: Trump Unveils Latest Tariff Rates With the Philippines at 20%

author: Magdalena Del Valle
description: The US applied more pressure on Iran with sanctions targeting companies that help the country sell oil through a “shadow banking” network for the benefit of its most powerful paramilitary force.
title: New US Sanctions Target Iran’s Shadow Banking Network

description: He cited physician-patient privilege and his right under the Fifth Amendment.
title: Biden's Former Doctor Refuses to Answer Questions in House Republican Probe

author: Cam Kettles
description: Executives at America’s largest corporations watched Donald Trump sign a massive tax-cut bill without any change in their own companies’ tax rates — and were grateful for their good luck.
title: A Status Quo Rate in Trump Tax Bill Is Big Win for Corporations

author: Max Ramsay
description: The United Arab Emirates is set to exit the European Union’s “black list” of countries with deficient controls over illicit money flows, after the bloc’s lawmakers approved a revision to the ledger.
title: UAE Makes Stride Toward Removal From EU’s Dirty Money Risk List

author: Michael Nienaber, Aaron Kirchfeld, Samy Adghirni
description: German Chancellor Friedrich Merz and French President Emmanuel Macron will seek to quell a growing Franco-German squabble over the countries’ next-generation fighter jet when they meet for high-profile consultations in Berlin later this month.
title: Merz to Meet Macron in Bid to Resolve Growing Fighter Jet Rift

author: Michael O'Boyle
description: The US Treasury is granting a temporary reprieve to three Mexican financial firms it moved to cut off from the US financial system, citing progress by the country’s government in addressing money laundering by drug trafficking cartels.
title: Mexican Firms Targeted by US for Laundering Get 45-Day Reprieve

author: Akayla Gardner, Greg Ryan
description: President Donald Trump’s administration is intensifying its fight against Harvard University, warning that its accreditation may be in danger and formally moving to subpoena the school in a bid for information on foreign students.
title: US Threatens Harvard Accreditation, Subpoenas Student Data

author: Patpicha Tanakasempipat
description: Thaksin Shinawatra, the de facto leader of Thailand’s ruling party, expects a court to ultimately clear allegations of ethical misconduct against his daughter, Prime Minister Paetongtarn Shinawatra, who was suspended from office last month.
title: Thaksin Confident Thai Court Will Clear Daughter’s Suspension as PM in Ethics Case

author: Sabrina Nelson Garcinuno
description: Spain wants to create a two-tier pricing system for certain drugs that are in high demand after facing supply shortages due to off-label use of the medication.
title: Spain Wants Certain Drugs to Be Priced Higher for Off-Label Use

author: Ruchi Bhatia, Sudhi Ranjan Sen, Shruti Srivastava
description: President Donald Trump’s threat to impose new tariffs on India over its participation in the BRICS forum puts New Delhi in a tough position as it races to finalize a favorable trade deal with the US.
title: Trump’s BRICS Warning to India Adds New Twist to Trade Deal

author: Kateryna Chursina
description: Ukraine said it detained two Chinese citizens on suspicion of espionage regarding the missile system Kyiv used to sink Moscow’s Black Sea flagship in the early stages of Russia’s full-scale invasion.
title: Ukraine Detains Two Chinese Nationals on Suspicion of Spying

author: Firat Kozok
description: Profane posts generated by the Grok artificial intelligence chatbot on Elon Musk’s X are unacceptable and could lead to a ban on the platform in Turkey, according to a government minister.
title: Turkey Slams Musk’s X Over Profanity in Latest Challenge to Grok

author: Joe Mayes
description: UK Prime Minister Keir Starmer declined to rule out extending a freeze in income tax thresholds as his government faces growing pressure to boost tax revenues in order to fill a swelling budgetary hole.
title: Starmer Declines to Rule Out UK Income Tax Thresholds Freeze

author: Rene Vollgraaff
description: South Africa’s parliamentary Speaker Thoko Didiza denied a request by two political parties to hold a debate on allegations that the police minister and senior national officials interfered in an investigation into political assassinations.
title: South African Parliament Denies Request to Debate Police Claims

author: Maciej Martewicz, Konrad Krasuski
description: Poland is scrapping plans to carve out unprofitable coal assets from state-controlled utilities and instead seeks to introduce new support measures to keep the country’s electricity system stable.
title: Poland Scraps Coal Spinoff Plan, Eyes New Support for Utilities

author: Alex Morales
description: UK doctors plan to go on strike for five days at the end of the month after Health Secretary Wes Streeting told them he won’t negotiate with them on their pay demands.
title: UK Resident Doctors Plan to Strike in Late July, Union Says

author: Zoltan Simon
description: Viktor Orban dialed up Hungary’s clash with the European Union, calling for the ouster of the European Commission president as his government rejected the bloc’s economic-policy recommendations.
title: Orban Escalates Fight With EU Over Confidence Vote, Fiscal Fixes

author: Kamailoudini Tagba
description: US President Donald Trump is scheduled this week to meet the leaders of five African nations that will potentially offer American businesses opportunities in critical minerals and other natural resources.
title: Trump to Host African Leaders Offering Major Mining Ventures

author: Anthony Halpin
description: Welcome to Balance of Power, bringing you the latest in global politics. If you haven’t yet, sign up here.
title: Trump Starts to Sour on Putin Over Ukraine

author: Gaspard Sebag
description: French police raided the headquarters of the far-right National Rally on Wednesday in an investigation into suspicions of unlawful funding of its latest presidential campaign, a move the party’s head immediately branded as “harassment.”
title: French Far-Right Party HQ Raided by Police Over Campaign Funding

author: Lucille Liu
description: China challenged Germany’s accusation that one if its warships behaved dangerously toward a plane in the Red Sea, further complicating Beijing’s ties with Europe.
title: China Calls German Claim of Laser Targeting Plane ‘Inconsistent’

author: Wojciech Moskwa
description: Poland’s government wants the European Union to investigate and possibly fine Elon Musk’s xAI following abusive and lewd comments made by its artificial intelligence chatbot Grok about the country’s politicians.
title: Poland Calls for EU Probe of xAI After Lewd Rants by Chatbot

author: Courtney McBride, Anthony Capaccio
description: The US Army plans to spend more than $1.3 billion on Patriot missiles for the fiscal year beginning Oct. 1, and has quietly quadrupled its overall purchase target for the air defense weapon that has proven critical not just for Ukraine but also for US forces in the Middle East.
title: US Army Pushes for Massive Boost in Patriot Missile Inventory

author: Soo-Hyang Choi
description: Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov will visit North Korea this week, Pyongyang’s state media reported, less than a month after leader Kim Jong Un agreed to send thousands of military workers to help Moscow.
title: Russia’s Top Diplomat Lavrov to Visit North Korea This Week

author: Mpho Hlakudi
description: Emerging market currencies extended declines on Wednesday as investors mulled the implications of US President Donald Trump’s trade regime, while weak Chinese price data also weighed on sentiment.
title: Emerging Currencies Extend Declines on Trade Turmoil, China Data

author: Lucille Liu
description: China hit back at European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen after she accused the nation of distorting trade and limiting access for Europe’s firms — a back-and-forth clouding the outlook for an upcoming summit.
title: China Rebukes EU Chief After Demand for Greater Trade Access

author: Daniel Basteiro
description: Spanish Prime Minister Pedro Sanchez announced a barrage of anti-corruption mechanisms as he seeks to overcome a graft scandal involving two close collaborators that has rocked his government.
title: Spain’s Sanchez Announces Anti Corruption Laws Amid Graft Probe

author: Olesia Safronova
description: Russia launched a record number of drones and missiles at Ukraine on Wednesday after US President Donald Trump reiterated his displeasure with Vladimir Putin and confirmed he’s sending more defensive weapons to Kyiv.
title: Russia Launches Drone Attack After Trump’s Ukraine Weapons Vow

author: Prinesha Naidoo
description: South Africa’s Department of Justice and Constitutional Development will heed advice from the finance minister and ask private companies to help revamp dilapidated court buildings due to budget limitations.
title: South Africa to Tap Private Firms to Revamp Crumbling Courts

author: Okech Francis
description: South Sudan took in eight deportees from the United States in a bid to normalize relations with the US, the African nation’s foreign affairs ministry said.
title: US Deportees Welcomed Into South Sudan to ‘Normalize Relations’

author: Anthony Halpin
description: Asset seizures are surging in Russia, further clouding the outlook for the country’s slowing economy even as they help shore up increasingly depleted state coffers.
title: Kremlin’s $50 Billion Asset Grab Deepens Russian Economic Woes

description: SEOUL, South Korea (AP) — A South Korean court early Thursday approved the new arrest of former President Yoon Suk Yeol on charges related to his brief imposition of martial law in December, accepting a special prosecutor’s claim that he poses a risk of destroying evidence.
title: Court Approves New Arrest of Ex-Korean President Yoon Over Marial Law

author: Cliff Harvey Venzon
description: The Philippines said its visiting forces agreement with Canada is ready for signing, as the Southeast Asian nation builds a coalition of like-minded nations and deterrence amid tensions with China.
title: Philippines Says Canada Troops Pact Ready, Eyes China Deterrence

author: Ram Anand
description: Malaysia’s Prime Minister Anwar Ibrahim said he will appeal for lower tariffs when he meets Secretary of State Marco Rubio on Thursday after President Donald Trump threatened to impose a steeper rate.
title: Malaysia’s Anwar to Discuss US Tariffs With Rubio on Thursday

author: Yian Lee
description: China placed eight Taiwanese suppliers of military equipment on an export control list, a move that’s likely to have a limited impact on the armed forces of the self-run democracy.
title: China Bans Dual-Use Exports to Eight Taiwan Defense Entities

author: Akayla Gardner
description: The Education Department will soon begin to charge interest on student debt for an estimated 7.7 million borrowers who’ve been in legal limbo since a repayment plan created by President Joe Biden was blocked in court.
title: Nearly 8 Million US Student-Loan Borrowers to See Interest Charges Again

author: Katia Dmitrieva, Erica Yokoyama, Shruti Srivastava
description: Trade negotiators from around the world have been racking up miles flying to Washington to strike a deal with President Donald Trump — especially Asian delegations who have the farthest to go. With final agreements still out of reach for most, the travel isn’t slowing down anytime soon.
title: Asia Trade Chiefs Travel 800 Hours to Secure Elusive US Deals

author: Heesu Lee
description: South Korea’s household lending surged in June at the fastest pace in 10 months, driven by a hot property market in Seoul that’s complicating the central bank’s efforts to support the economy with looser policy.
title: Korea’s Household Loan Surge Puts Rate-Cut Plans Under Pressure

author: Swati Pandey
description: Australia is “urgently seeking” more detail on President Donald Trump’s threat to impose 200% tariffs on pharmaceutical imports to the US, Treasurer Jim Chalmers said.
title: Australia ‘Urgently Seeking’ Detail on Trump’s Drug Tariff Threat

author: Yian Lee
description: Taiwan indicated it was cautiously optimistic about talks with the US after it avoided getting a letter from the Trump administration notifying trading partners of new tariff rates.
title: Taiwan Signals Cautious Optimism After Avoiding US Tariff Letter

author: Soo-Hyang Choi
description: President Donald Trump said South Korea should pay more for its own defense, upping pressure on the Asian ally after sending a letter to extend time for negotiations before 25% across-the-board levies are set to kick in for its shipments to the US.
title: Trump Pressures South Korea to Pay More for Defense
